claim: Recombinant technology leads to a broader immune response that may provide cross-protection, even in a mismatch season.
explanation: Partial text from a clinical report discussing relative vaccine effectiveness (rVE) of recombinant quadrivalent influenza vaccine (RIV4) versus standard-dose inactivated quadrivalent influenza vaccine (SD-IIV4) across age and subgroup analyses, with rVE percentages and confidence intervals for younger adults, older adults, males, and those without high-risk conditions. does not support the claim because the snippet presents only comparative effectiveness data for RIV4 versus SD-IIV4 and does not address broader immune response, cross-protection, or performance in mismatch seasons Note: Image is a partial text snippet; the full table is not visible and there is no mention of cross-protection or mismatch season in the visible content.
